Contributing to Delinquency of a Child

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre G. Simmons

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(Cases 21CF842, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 21CM433, 22CF70, 22CF306, 22CF322, 22CF655 are called at 2:00 PM) Defendant Andre G. Simmons in court, in custody with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin.  
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense indicates there is an agreement. State recites the joint sentence resolution. 
22CF655- Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Identity Theft as Party to a Crime. 
22CF306- Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- False Imprisonment as Domestic. 
22CF70- Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 10- Maintaining a Drug Trafficking Place. 
21CF842- Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Neglecting a Child (Specific Harm Did Not Occur and Child <6 years). 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including all of 21CM433, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 22CF322. 
Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation- Defense is free to argue and the State is bound by the PSI recommendation. 
Sentencing Hearing: 12/22/2022 at 3:00 PM (set for 1 hour- IN PERSON). 
Parties request that bonds be revoked in 21CF842, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 21CM433, 22CF70, 22CF306, 22CF322, 22CF655. Court orders that bonds are revoked in 21CF842, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 21CM433, 22CF70, 22CF306, 22CF322, 22CF655.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

(4:01 PM cases 21CM433, 21CF842, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 22CF70, 22CF306, 22CF322, 22CF655 called.) Defendant Andre G. Simmons in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Andre G. Simmons. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Attorney Thorson advises had a conversation with the State this morning and the offer was modified at that time.
Attorney Thorson advises has gone over the modified offer with the defendant and there is an agreement. Attorney Thorson needs time to complete the paperwork with the defendant.
Status Conference (possible plea) in cases 21CM433, 21CF842, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 22CF70, 22CF306, 22CF322, 22CF655 scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 2 pm (1/2 hour) in person.
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

(9:05 AM cases 21CM433, 21CF842, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 22CF70, 22CF306, 22CF322, 22CF655 called.) Judge Beverly Wickstrom for Branch 3. 
Defendant Andre G. Simmons in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Andre G. Simmons. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Thorson advises has received an offer from the State and has had several discussions. Attorney Thorson advises the defendant would like additional time to review the offer.
Attorney Thorson requesting another status conference. 
State agrees with setting another status conference.
Parties to schedule a Status Conference with the Branch 3 Judicial Assistant about 2-4 weeks out.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:16 PM cases 21CM433, 21CF1139, 21CF842, 22CF306, 21CF1337, 22CF7022CF655, 22CF322 called. Defendant Andre G. Simmons in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Andre G. Simmons.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
In 22CF655: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
All files: Parties are still in negotiations for a global offer. 
All files: A status conference is scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 9:00 AM ( in person, 30 min).
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:04 AM cases 21CF1139, 22CF70, 21CF842, 22CF306, 21CM433, 22CF322, 22CF655, 21CF1337 called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andre G. Simmons in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Andre G. Simmons. 
Defense requests another status conference to allow time to speak with the assigned ADA . 
A status conference is scheduled for 8/23/22 at 3:00 PM (in person, 30 min).
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:33 PM Cases called: 21CF842, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 21CM433, 22CF70, 22CF306, 22CF322 and 22CF655. Defendant Andre G. Simmons in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Andre G. Simmons. Attorney Afton Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

22CF655: Waives reading of the complaint. Advised of potential penalties and charges. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 

All cases STC: 08/04/22 at 10am in person 30 min
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:30 AM cases 21CF842, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 21CM433, 22CF70, 22CF306 and 22CF322 called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andre G. Simmons appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Andre G. Simmons. Victim/Witness statute complied with in all files. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver.  In all felony files: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
All files: A status conference is scheduled for 07/11/22 at 3:30 PM (in person).
Same as Complaint
Arraignment on May 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(Cases 22CF322, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 22CF70, 22CF306, 21CF842, 21CM433 are called at 2:05 PM) Defendant Andre G. Simmons in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Andre G. Simmons.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF322, 21CF1139. Defendant also waives right to preliminary hearing to all Felony Bail Jumping charges in 22CF70, 21CF1337, 22CF306, 21CF842. 
21CF1337- State calls Sergeant Jacob Henning, Altoona Police Department- sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Sergeant Henning by Defense. Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 case.
22CF70- State recalls Sergeant Jacob Henning, Altoona Police Department- sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Sergeant Henning by Defense. Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 case.
22CF306- State recalls Officer Timothy Peterson, Altoona Police Department- sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Officer Peterson by Defense. Re-direct examination of Officer Peterson by State. Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 case. 
21CF842- State calls Detective Zachary Burnett, Eau Claire Police Department- sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Detective Burnett by Defense. Witness excused. 
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 3 case. 
All cases (22CF322, 21CF1139, 21CF1337, 22CF70, 22CF306, 21CF842, 21CM433) to be scheduled for Arraignment with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.

9:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andre G. Simmons appeared by video, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Andre G. Simmons. Defense is waiting on an offer from the State. Warrant that was previously ordered, but stayed, will not be issued. All cases to be scheduled for 04/13/22.
Status hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status hearing on April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson

Conditions:
No contact with R.R. or S.D..
No contact with 3411 Sherwin Ave, Altoona, WI 54720.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia. 
No possession or care of any animals.

11:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andre G. Simmons appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Waives reading of complaint. State requests $10,000 cash bond with argument. Defense requests lower cash bond with argument. Court orders $2,500 cash bond. Time limits for the preliminary hearing are waived. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 2-7-22 at 1:45 PM. Return to court: 3-2-22 at 9:30 AM.
